text:
Looking to duplicate the process seen here but the instructions are vague:
<http://designers.HubSpot.com/blog/creating-a-portfolio-with-HubSpot-cos>
We have a client that want an interface to upload and hold a custom layout and custom modules within a blog post will seem to work best.

Looks like a custom module was built, then the fields were added to the post template. Does this add it to the edit screen when you add the HubL to the post code? Just looking for a bit more direction on setup. Thanks!
<@U2H23SN0Z> when you are inside the custom module you add a new field
then in your module you will have stuff like hits
<@U25PYL3Q8|nickdeckerdevs> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/nickdeckerdevs/F2HHRNPB4/pasted_image_at_2016_09_29_10_08_am.png|this:>
that are all the "fields" i placed in my module
here is an example of an image field you can create
<@U25PYL3Q8|nickdeckerdevs> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/nickdeckerdevs/F2HHKRKU1/pasted_image_at_2016_09_29_10_08_am.png|image field>
So, the label, the help text -- those you will see when editing the page. That will show up with the information you provide while setting up. Then you can set defaults.
here is more on custom modules: <http://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/cos/custom-modules>

The article isn't a tutorial, so you have some uneasiness if this is your first time. Just try adding a custom module with one field and setting it up -- that way it is very easy to see if it is working or not

I have the custom module created.  Sorry if I wasnt clear on my ask. My question really is how would I tie it to the blog post and be able to us it in a duplicated function? Do I define the widget fields as part of the post template?  Does the post then pull this data vs the default module code?
have you inserted the module into the blog yet?
the blog template

<@U25PYL3Q8|nickdeckerdevs> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/nickdeckerdevs/F2HJLTQB0/pasted_image_at_2016_09_29_11_26_am.png|have you added your custom modules into the blog yet, like it shows here>
I have added the module to the template, but have not added to the calls to the template.  just add the fields into the template?
just like you see in that section, just add a simple one, save it, then go add a blog post
you will see them pop up.
ok cool
and that will fill in the custom module based of the slug correct?
you simply click edit post template, add the module, save, then open a blog post using the template
and you will see the new option there

thanks nick, the custom module is now showing Is there a way for certain parts to show from the custom module only on the listing side?

When I load a blog post I have the custom module working, but certain parts only pertain to the listing page not the post
You would add the {{ widget.whatever.module.hubl }} to the listing template
you just need to include the output of it on the listing page
I think it has to be inside the content for contents loop
if I recall

Understand that. but on the post page itself, all elements of the custom module show. For example, I want a custom CTA to show only on the listing side, it is also showing on the post side.  Is there any way around that?
<@U2H23SN0Z|curiositymg> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/curiositymg/F2HL7D6S2/hub-screen.jpg|hub-screen.jpg> and commented: This is how the module is placed.
okay
you have a custom module
those really need to be placed into the template
into the post template
so pull the code out of the module and just use it vs the custom module?
so in your custom moudle you problbay have osmething similar to this: {% cta "floating_cta" guid="", overriable=true, label="Bottom CTA" %}
yep
you would change that to include the template
{% cta "floating_cta" guid="", overriable=true, label="Bottom CTA", export_to_template_context=True  %}
a comma
then export_to_template_context=True
that makes it so it shows up on each blog post
sorry if I confused you earlier by saying custom module -- I realized what I did there
no worries.  so add the ", export_to_template_context=True  % to each field.
that will over ride and push to the desired place.
yup
make sure you are inside the edit post template
<@U25PYL3Q8|nickdeckerdevs> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/nickdeckerdevs/F2HLXC2AE/pasted_image_at_2016_09_29_01_13_pm.png|Pasted image at 2016-09-29, 1:13 PM>
